items.title: Flex wrapping detection in CSS sure would be handy
items.content:
#‚Äã581 ‚Äî February 22, 2023 | Read on the web

Web Push for Web Apps on iOS and iPadOS ‚Äî iOS and iPadOS 16.4 beta 1 comes with support for Web Push for home screen web apps, the badging API, screen wake lock API, and more. It‚Äôs now possible for a web app to send home screen push notifications to users with the Push API, Notifications API, and Service Workers all working¬†together.

Eidson and Simmons (WebKit)

React Authentication, Simplified ‚Äî In this article, we lay out a new approach to authentication (plus access control & SSO) in React¬†applications.

Userfront sponsor

Do We Need CSS flex-wrap Detection? ‚Äî A considered explainer as to why flex wrapping detection in CSS would be handy, along with some use-cases highlighting the potential¬†benefit.

Ahmad Shadeed

Last Baseline Alignment ‚Äî Alignment using the first and last keywords is now available in all major engines. This means that we can use last baseline alignment as another option when aligning groups of flex or grid¬†items.

Rachel Andrew

‚ö°Ô∏è IN BRIEF

  • Can ChatGPT write good CSS? ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Zoran Jambor says yes.

  • The release notes for Safari 16.4 beta ‚Äì adding over 130 new features.

  • What's new in DevTools for Chrome Canary 111? This post has the rundown, including a look at an enhanced breakpoint UX.

  • All of the modules in the excellent 'Learn HTML!' resource/course, penned by Estelle Weyl, are now available ‚Äî the latest modules cover forms, images, and¬†APIs.

  • Kevin Powell runs through five useful CSS properties that don't get enough attention, including the isolation and inset properties.

  • MS has been spotted inserting ads for Edge into the Chrome download page. üò¨

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

A Step-By-Step Guide to Building Accessible Carousels ‚Äî Most carousels come with some usability and accessibility issues. This article addresses such problems with step-by-step design considerations as well as semantic requirements for carousels to be¬†accessible.

Sonja Weckenmann

How To Optimize Resource Loading With Priority Hints ‚Äî Speed up your website by assigning a priority to your requests, for example to load a hero image¬†earlier.

DebugBear sponsor

The User Activation API ‚Äî As a web developer, you‚Äôve probably noticed that certain APIs only work if an end-user clicks or taps on an HTML element. Well, the UserActivation API can help determine if it‚Äôs OK to call a function that depends on user activation, as explained¬†here.

Marcos Caceres (WebKit)

Using Focal Points, Aspect Ratio & Object-Fit to Crop Images Correctly ‚Äî A look at using CSS to crop images whilst ensuring the focal point stays in¬†place.

Henry Desroches

(255,255,255) is the Highest Specificity ‚Äî An exploration of how browser engines store specificity and what, if any, its limits are. This is not something you‚Äôll likely run up against in practice, and if you do the author urges you ‚Äúto stop writing bad CSS selectors like¬†that‚Äù.

Bramus Van Damme

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Astro 2.0, Island Architecture, and React with Fred K. Schott

Whiskey Web and Whatnot sponsorpodcast

Use a MutationObserver to Handle DOM Nodes that Don‚Äôt Exist Yet ‚Äî Comparing the effectiveness of the MutationObserver API with the conventional method of constantly checking for the creation of¬†nodes.

Alex MacArthur

Supporting CSS Multi Direction Languages in¬†2023
Elad Shechter

Create a Rainbow-Colored List with :nth-of-type()
Rach Smith

Building a Lightbox with the Dialog Element
Polypane

üîß Code, Tools & Resources

CSS Doodle: A Web Component for Drawing Patterns with¬†CSS ‚Äî A Custom Elements-based component that builds an internal grid of DIV elements and then populates them using CSS to create patterns. GitHub¬†repo.

Yuan Chuan

ScrollTrigger: Let Your Page React to Scroll Changes ‚Äî Triggers classes based on the current scroll position. So, for example, when an element enters the viewport you can fade it¬†in.

Erik Terwan

No SVG, No Image, CSS-Only Fluid Slider with input[type=range] ‚Äî This is an impressive CSS demo, showcasing an animated, color-changing slider. Browser support for certain features used (such as color-mix) is¬†limited.

Ana Tudor Codepen

Kobalte: A UI Toolkit for Building Accessible Web Apps and Design Systems with SolidJS ‚Äî The components are unstyled and follow WAI-ARIA authoring practices. You also have granular access to each component part, allowing you to add event listeners, props, etc.

Kobalte

Unicopy: Copy Unicode Characters and¬†Symbols ‚Äî There are lots of these types of sites but you might like this one because it has only the basics, divided into five¬†categories.

Magnus Hvidtfeldt

üßë‚Äçüíª JOBS

Software Engineer ‚Äî Join our happy team. Stimulus is a social platform started by Sticker Mule to show what's possible if your mission is to increase human¬†happiness.
Stimulus

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profile¬†now.
Hired

üåõ Dark Mode, The Easy Way?

Over on Twitter, Flavio Copes had a great demonstration of a quick way to create a 'dark mode' for a site. Invert the colors, then invert back the things you don't want to change, like images and code examples:

There can be some downsides to this approach but it might be enough to get you thinking about the colors you'd want to use.

items.title: You can try (native) CSS nesting now
items.content:
#‚Äã580 ‚Äî February 15, 2023 | Read on the web

You Can Try Out Native CSS Nesting Today ‚Äî Back in December, the WebKit team shared an article and poll detailing three different potential options for CSS Nesting ‚Äî¬†option three won. Now, with Safari and Chrome have implemented it, meaning you can give native nesting a try in Safari Technology Preview¬†162 and Chrome 112 (or current Dev builds). Bryce Wray decided to give it a go, and you can read the results of his experimentation here.

Jen Simmons (WebKit)

Set up Core Web Vitals Tracking in Minutes ‚Äî As a Google search ranking factor for site speed and UX, Web Vitals are key metrics for you to track. Measure Vitals on your site. Quickly see what you need to fix. Set up continuous monitoring and alerts so you can track regressions and stay¬†fast.

SpeedCurve sponsor

The Modern Web‚Äôs Underrated Powerhouse ‚Äî CSS has come a long way (especially in recent years), but Klint notes that it still doesn‚Äôt get the attention that JavaScript does, despite being one of the most important building blocks of the¬†internet.

Klint Finley

What's New in Lighthouse 10 ‚Äî Lighthouse, Chrome‚Äôs website auditing tool, has just reached version 10, introducing changes to the way in which things are scored, and new¬†audits.

Brendan Kenny (Chrome Developers)

‚ö°Ô∏è IN BRIEF

  • Jecelyn Yeen runs through what's new in DevTools in Chrome 110 including recorder updates, better syntax highlighting and more.

  • After Dave Rupert and Eric Meyer, Ahmad Shadeed gets in on the CSS wishlisting action.

  • Firefox 110 is out: Release notes and developer changes.

  • Following a power cut, Andy Bell reminds us of the importance of performance and progressive enhancement.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Container Queries Land in Stable Browsers ‚Äî Support for container queries and container query units are now in all three major browser engines. They‚Äôre particularly useful for responsive design and reusable components. This post shows a quick demo of how to use¬†them.

üí¨ ‚ÄúWith container queries you can query the styling information of a parent element, such as its inline-size. With media queries, you could query the size of the viewport, container queries enable components that can change based on where they are in the UI.‚Äù ‚Äî Una Kravets

How to Inspect Interactions in the Browser ‚Äî Trying to debug elements that have popovers? Inspection can be tricky. This post shows two ways to overcome this annoyance and properly inspect interactions in your¬†browser.

Sami Jaber

Dynaboard: A Visual Web App IDE Made for Developers ‚Äî Build high performance public and private web applications in a collaborative ‚Äî full-stack ‚Äî development¬†environment.

Dynaboard sponsor

Introducing Historical Web Performance Data via the CrUX History API ‚Äî Learn about the new Chrome UX Report (CrUX) History API and how to use it to track user experience¬†trends.

Henkel, Yan, Pollard (Chrome Developers)

‚ñ∂¬†¬†'My Talk On CSS Runtime Performance' ‚Äî Following a ton of research on how browsers actually work under the hood Nolan delivered this thorough, hour-long presentation on ‚Äúall the heroic work that browser vendors have done over the years to make CSS so¬†performant‚Äù.

Nolan Lawson

An Animated Flythrough with Theatre.js and React Three Fiber ‚Äî How to fly through a 3D scene using the Theatre.js JavaScript animation library and the React Three Fiber 3D¬†renderer.

Andrew Prifer (Codrops)

Using Playwright to Monitor Third-Party Resources That Could Impact User Experience ‚Äî While implementing third-party resources has downsides for performance and you should self-host your assets when possible, sometimes relying on external files is unavoidable. This post looks at how to evaluate and monitor such resources using Playwright.

Stefan Judis

Five Beginner Website Speed Optimizations and How to Do Them¬†Right ‚Äî Some beginner-friendly strategies for improving your site¬†performance.

Ben Schwarz beginner

"You Kinda Want An Orange Favicon" ‚Äî On the woes of finding a nice favicon which works across both dark and light modes¬†equally‚Ä¶

Chris Coyier

Change Tab Bar Color Dynamically using JavaScript
Amit Merchant

Different Ways to Get CSS Gradient Shadows
Temani Afif

Why I'm Not The Biggest Fan of Single Page Applications
Manuel Matuzoviƒá

üîß Code, Tools & Resources

Tailwind Elements: 500+ Bootstrap Components Recreated with Tailwind CSS ‚Äî A pretty ambitious project! It claims to offer better design and more functionality compared to Bootstrap. You can judge for yourself but the design is very ‚ÄúBootstrap-esque‚Äù.

Tailwind Elements

Build Business Software 10x Faster with Retool

Retool sponsor

Bookmarklet Editor: Easily Work on JavaScript Bookmarklets ‚Äî Useful because who can remember the exact syntax for a bookmarklet? ü§î This also can instantly convert code to and from bookmarklet form and includes some examples in the help section (click the big ? to get all the¬†details).

Marek Gibney

Unicorn Icons: 100+ Animated Icons in SVG and JSON Formats ‚Äî Lots of nice unique examples here and they‚Äôre free for commercial projects, but note that the license does require¬†attribution.

Unicorn Icons

Font Library: An Open Source Project to Tag and Organize Google¬†Fonts ‚Äî This offers many of the same features as the Google Fonts platform, but also includes the ability to select subsets, variants, and sort by community-curated tags that you can contribute¬†to.

katy decorah

üßë‚Äçüíª JOBS

Software Engineer ‚Äî Join our happy team. Stimulus is a social platform started by Sticker Mule to show what's possible if your mission is to increase human¬†happiness.
Stimulus

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profile¬†now.
Hired

ü´µ¬†It's pointing at you...

Pointer Pointer ‚Äî Ok, so this one isn‚Äôt new and has been around for a few years, but it‚Äôs a fun little thing that seems to have resurfaced this past week on social. Point your mouse cursor anywhere, and the site finds a picture that points at your pointer. üòÖ

items.title: Blink and Gecko on iOS one day?
items.content:
#‚Äã579 ‚Äî February 8, 2023 | Read on the web

The Guide to Responsive Design in 2023 & Beyond ‚Äî Ahmad shares a detailed look at modern responsive web design, offering a thoughtful take on how we should think about things in 2023. An excellent and up-to-date primer which may get you thinking about certain¬†approaches.

Ahmad Shadeed

Mozilla, Google Looking Ahead to the End of Apple's WebKit? ‚Äî Following word of Chrome‚Äôs Blink-based efforts, work on a Gecko-based version of Firefox for iOS is also said to be underway. Currently only WebKit-powered browsers are allowed on Apple‚Äôs iOS ‚Äî¬†but the hope from Google and Mozilla is that this will¬†change.

Thomas Claburn

New Courses on the React Learning Path ‚Äî React Performance: Optimize React applications for maximum perfromance. React & TypeScript: Create robust and reliable React apps at¬†Scale.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Ten Web Development Trends in 2023 ‚Äî Following the State of JS survey results Robin takes a considered look at new web dev trends that we should be paying attention to this year, and why they¬†matter.

Robin Wieruch

Announcing Interop 2023 ‚Äî 'Interop' is an ongoing cross-browser effort to ‚Äúincrease interoperability across browsers in key technical areas‚Äù. In 2022 significant improvements were made. This post from Mozilla outlines the plan for the year ahead.

James Graham (Mozilla)

ü§ù MORE ON INTEROP:

  • This post from the Chrome team outlines the specific 26 focus areas for Interop this year.
  • ..and here's a post from the WebKit team outlining their 2023¬†commitment.
  • You can see a live dashboard of 2023's Interop efforts.
  • This post gives an overview of the outcomes of the Interop 2022 project.

‚ö°Ô∏è IN BRIEF

  • Microsoft is adding new AI-powered search features to Bing and Edge.

  • This Tweet thread looks at why making a dark mode is so tricky to get right, and shares some¬†tips.

  • Here's an in-depth, web-based course for working with images on the¬†web.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

How To Build a 'Magazine Layout' with CSS Grid Areas ‚Äî A practical look at how to use the capabilities of CSS Grid to ‚Äúachieve layouts that look like they were laid out by¬†hand‚Äù.

Jennifer Brehm

ElementInternals and Form-Associated Custom Elements ‚Äî As of Safari Technology Preview 162 support for the ElementInternals API is enabled, bringing it up to speed with other¬†browsers.

Ryosuke Niwa

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Self-Hosting Fonts (@font-face) Explained (including Google¬†Fonts) ‚Äî A 15-minute video from Kevin in his usual accessible style on hosting fonts, making them performant, and why you may need to do it yourself anyway when it comes to GDPR¬†compliance.

Kevin Powell

‚ñ∂¬†¬†"React Isn't Great at Anything Except Being Popular" with Josh¬†Collinsworth

Whiskey Web and Whatnot sponsorpodcast

A color-contrast() Strategy for Complementary Translucent¬†Backgrounds ‚Äî Adam demos a potential ‚Äòfuture CSS trick‚Äô for dynamically contrasting text with a supportive translucent background to ensure maximum accessibility. Read the comments for further context, as this is just a bit of wish casting at this¬†point.

Adam Argyle

Bringing Letters to Life: Coding a Kinetic SVG Typography Animation ‚Äî Learn how to recreate a neat motion type effect using SVG and¬†GreenSock. There's code examples and CodePen demos to help things along.

Louis Hoebregts

'My Favourite 3 Lines of CSS' ‚Äî ...revealing just how powerful CSS custom properties¬†are.

Andy Bell

How to Favicon in 2023: Six Files That Fit Most Needs
Andrey Sitnik

Building a Stylish Masonry Layout using CSS and JavaScript
Andrico Karoulla

Testing Color Accessibility with Dev Tools
Michelle Barker

Quirks of the Page Visibility API
Matt Joseph

üîß Code, Tools & Resources

Vanilla List: A Directory of Vanilla JavaScript Plugins ‚Äî But note that the plugins themselves may have multiple dependencies, just not stuff like jQuery, React, etc.

Glitch.Family

‚ñ∂¬†¬†ScrollyVideo.js: Responsive 'Scrollable' Videos ‚Äî It‚Äôs an interesting effect and well demonstrated here. Compatible with React, Svelte, Vue, or just plain ole‚Äô HTML.

Daniel Kao

Don‚Äôt Let Your Issue Tracker Be a Four-Letter Word. Use Shortcut ‚Äî The best issue tracking software is one that software developers are actually happy to¬†use.

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

lawnmower: A Library to Build VR Layouts Using HTML Tags ‚Äî A web component library that aims ‚Äúto make building a basic VR website as easy to make as your first HTML site‚Äù. There‚Äôs a 10-minute video showing it off¬†here. Getting flashbacks to the X3D and VRML eras¬†:-)

Gareth Marland

Swiper 9.0: Mobile Touch Slider with Accelerated Transitions ‚Äî Tree shakable, library agnostic, and focused entirely on modern browsers and web APIs. RTL support too. GitHub¬†repo.

Vladimir Kharlampidi

URL Animations: Add Loading Animations to a Site's URL ‚Äî Certainly a novelty that you won‚Äôt use on many projects, if any! You can check out lots of different live examples here.
